title: Stay One Step Ahead: Prevent Criminal Activities in Your Rented Properties
excerpt: Recent headlines show a worrying trend of rented properties being linked to criminal activities.
content: Rented properties can sometimes become hotspots for illicit activities, putting landlords and tenants at risk. Implementing thorough background checks for tenants, installing surveillance systems, and maintaining good relationships with neighbors are crucial steps to safeguard your properties. Regularly updating your rental policies and working closely with local law enforcement can also help identify and prevent potential criminal activities before they escalate.

title: The Unholy Marriage of Corruption & Due Diligence in Malaysia
excerpt: Malaysia’s meme calendar honoured an entrepreneur couple entangled in a major scandal.
content: Corruption scandals can significantly undermine public trust and corporate reputation. Malaysia has recently seen cases where due diligence processes were circumvented, enabling corrupt practices to flourish. Strengthening compliance frameworks, conducting thorough due diligence checks, and fostering a culture of transparency are vital to combat corruption. Organizations must adopt robust anti-corruption policies and ensure regular audits to protect themselves and contribute to national integrity.

title: Malaysian Employment Outlook 2025: Stability Amid Global Challenges
excerpt: Manpower Group’s survey of 10,095 employers shows signs of stability across APAC.
content: Despite economic uncertainties worldwide, Malaysia's job market is showing encouraging signs of resilience. According to recent surveys, sectors such as technology, healthcare, and manufacturing are expected to lead hiring growth in 2025. Employers are focusing on upskilling workers and adopting flexible work arrangements to adapt to evolving business needs. Understanding these trends is essential for job seekers and employers to navigate the shifting employment landscape effectively.
